sen.j: 和束町（わづかちょう）は、京都府相楽郡にある町である。
sen.e: Wazuka-cho is a town located in Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
Wazuka-cho is a town located in Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
Wazuka-cho is a town located in Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 「人が輝き美緑（みりょく）あふれる郷 和束」を町の標語に掲げている。
sen.e: The town adopts a motto 'Wazuka - Town full of attractive people and abundant with nature.'
The town adopted the motto 'Wazuka - Town full of attractive people and abundant with nature.'
The town adopted the motto 'Wazuka - Town full of attractive people and abundant with nature.'

sen.j: 町の特産品は、茶、松茸、トマト。
sen.e: Local products are tea, matsutake mushrooms, and tomatoes.
Local products are tea, matsutake mushrooms, and tomatoes.
Local products are tea, matsutake mushrooms, and tomatoes.

sen.j: 1954年（昭和29年）12月15日 相楽郡西和束村、中和束村、東和束村が合併して和束町誕生
sen.e: On December 15, 1954 Nishiwazuka-mura of Soraku-gun, Nakawazuka-mura, and Higashiwazuka-mura were merged to form Wazuka-cho.
On December 15, 1954 Nishiwazuka-mura of Soraku-gun, Nakawazuka-mura, and Higashiwazuka-mura were merged to form Wazuka-cho.
December 15, 1954: Nishiwazuka-mura, Nakawazuka-mura, and Higashiwazuka-mura of Soraku-gun were merged to form Wazuka-cho.
sen.cmt: 相楽郡の位置を変更しました。「"On"を使わない日付+半角コロン+半角スペース+文章」の形式に変更しました。

sen.j: 1956年（昭和31年） 3月31日 相楽郡湯船村を編入
sen.e: On March 31, 1956 Yubune-mura of Soraku-gun was incorporated into Wazuka-cho.
On March 31, 1956 Yubune-mura of Soraku-gun was incorporated into Wazuka-cho.
March 31, 1956: Yubune-mura of Soraku-gun was incorporated into Wazuka-cho.

sen.j: 町長：堀忠雄（ほりただお）（2005年4月～）2期目
sen.e: Mayor: Tadao HORI (from April 2005), second term
Mayor: Tadao HORI (from April 2005), second term

sen.j: 町内に鉄道はない。
sen.e: Railroad is not provided in the town.

sen.j: 奈良交通バスが西日本旅客鉄道関西本線木津駅 (京都府)・加茂駅 (京都府)と和束町とを結んでいる。
sen.e: Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd. operates bus services that connect Kizu Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on the Kansai Main Line operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West), and Wazuka-cho.
